name: Audubon Cottages

reviews.text: Traveled from Lafayette to wind up having a fantasy weekend in New Orleans with a girl friend who is a travel/foodie writer. I thought I would just drive & tag along, but what an extra-ordinary treat it was to stay Friday night in Cottage No.5. Before coming over I didn't have a lot of time to check out the history of the place, so had only put together that Audubon had stayed in one of the cottages (& maybe there was a bit of gossip about Elizabeth Taylor insisting on staying in one of the cottages too.) In Cottage No. 5 on the coffee table was indeed Audubon's book, but it would of taken more than a night's stay to enjoy such a large volume. My Granny if she were looking down from above would of been smiling, even with her dentures, especially when I turned to the page of the Brown Pelican. Because this was the one Audubon bird she had chosen to capture in watercolor, I think for one of her drawing classes we heard about as kids. After arriving in the rain, we got to valet parking at the Dauphine Hotel up the street & had the valet roll our bags to first thru the entry gate to the courtyard with the pool in it for the cottages & then another gate to our shared yet very private courtyard to our Cottage No 5. When he left we ran to the bar to check it out like a couple of kids new to a hotel room: there was a K-Cup coffee maker & many bottles of water--which I cannot tell you how great that is alone. I've traveled a lot & the first thing I usually want to have when I get to the room is a bottle of water--many times I will pack my own so I can have one, so here that's not a problem. Opening the fridge we saw it had 2 drawers, like in designer homes. On to the 2 bedrooms we find our big white clouds to sleep on & our signature robes with slippers. In the bathroom I'm told a story about the big black marble tiles originally being selected for the owners home by the wife only they ended up in the cottages instead. I love stories like this about places I stay at. Of course we had to go jump in the private pool in the middle of the courtyard garden first thing after putting our suitcases away & it was like having our own personal spa. Back out too soon to have to change/run off to the French Quarter for drinks/dinner, just steps outside our gate - feeling like we had our own house there in 'the' French Quarter--crazy good?! That night I know I slept like I was on a cloud--the next day I told my friend's husband who came to meet her when I had to leave that very same thing: you're going to get to Sleep on a Cloud. But that wasn't the end of the fantastic stay--there was breakfast served on our private courtyard table, steps from the tall slated window door, where you could go sit in your robe & slippers. I truly did not want this overnight to end. A great girls trip for sure, that if I hadn't gone with my friend I would of never gotten to go do such a thing. Big thank yous go to the cottages staff & management for having us/spoiling us after their recent gorgeous renovations. Truly I felt like a Princess for a Day staying at the Audubon Cottages!
reviews.title: Sleeping on a cloud in a French Quarter Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I knew about the Audubon Cottages but when I heard they were recently renovated I had to see what was new. The historic cottages arranged around a tropical courtyard are gorgeous and staying here is a trip back to a more romantic time in the French Quarter. The cottages are beautifully restored with comfortable beds and linens, oversized bathrooms, comfy seating areas and private patios. Roderick, our "French Quarter Butler" treated us like family. Be sure and try out the saltwater pool, reportedly the oldest pool in the Quarter. Also, Bayonna restaurant is nearby and I highly recommend it, plus Deanie's is one block further, more casual and less expensive but also fabulous - don't miss the onion rings and seafood platters! Everything is close by but once you're inside it feels like you're in another world.
reviews.title: Lovely historic property

reviews.text: The cottages are immaculate and magnificently renovated to maintain their authentic french quarter charm. Truly a very special place and a wonderful experience. We only wish we could meet someone like Roderick at every hotel! Thank you Roderick for making our stay so enjoyable we don't want to leave!
reviews.title: A very special way to experience New Orleans.

reviews.text: Located in the Heart of The French Quarter in New Orleans, just two blocks from Bourbon St., the very private Audubon Cottages are set admist tropical gardens, and surround the oldest swimming pool in all of New Orleans. I loved this lap-sized pool, especially in the evening when the very enchanting lighting lite the tropical gardens and waterfall that surrounds the brick walk around the pool. The same tropical gardens and waterfalls, with discreet lighting continue to the inside private courtyards of each of the cottages. My courtyard waterfall even had Koi - and had I stayed a bit longer I would have felt like they were my fish and I would have named them. That's how personal and 'homey' these 5 Star cottages are. The authentically restored Audubon Cottages will exceed your expectations, and delight everyone of your senses.
reviews.title: Escape from The Ordinary

reviews.text: Recenty, I had the good fortune to join my Mother & Sister-in-law in New Orleans for a girls getaway. We stayed at the beautiful Audubon Cottages(apart of The New Orleans Hotel Collection). The sumptous rooms and updated bathrooms were luxurious and inviting...however, we spent most of our time enjoying our sweet private courtyard! We so enjoyed breakfast and cocktails daily there. Our butler, Roderick Bernal oversaw every detail during our stay...he and his staff were very accomodating! It's the ideal location for a romantic getaway or, for a small family...or for the "girls"! Looking forward to a return trip soon!
reviews.title: Serene & ideallic setting in heart of the French Quarter!

reviews.text: I travel often and prefer historic hotels as they reflect the true ambiance of the city. A stay at Audubon Cottages is like stepping back to the mid 19th century when it was built. The owner was meticulous in the recent restoration, preserving original beams, floors, brick walls and brick patios. And the traditions of the plantation life continue with your own personal butler, Roderick. He attends to your every need including a romantic breakfast in your own private courtyard surrounded by tropical gardens. It's a New Orleans brand of Breakfast at Tiffany's, listening to the soothing trickle of the water garden, I could almost imagine John J. Audubon joining me for a cup of tea.
reviews.title: True charm of New Orleans

reviews.text: The Audubon cottages have always been our first choice for accomodations in New Orleans because of the comfort, atmosphere and privacy they provide. Since our last visit in July 2011, the property has changed ownership, resulting in huge improvements. Every cottage and private courtyard has received a major facelift: complete renovation of bathrooms, new paint, updated furniture and AC units, new "drawer" refrigerator and ice makers, beautifully manicured gardens and a refinished pool. All changes have been done in a way that provides modern comfort while preserving the history of these famous New Orleans cottages. Roderick Bernal, the new manager, and his assistant, Michael, provide first class service with attention to every detail. We look forward our next visit.
reviews.title: A Brand New Face for a Dear Old Friend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a frequent visitor to New Orleans (20+ times), and this was by far the best accommodations I have ever had there. The Audubon Cottages were private, luxurious, and comfortable. The manager, Roderick, and all of the staff were receptive to every possible need that me and my wife had. They were welcoming, courteous, and still professional. We have a new favorite to stay in in the French Quarter.
reviews.title: The Best Place To Stay in the Quarter
A New Orleans Gem!
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Audubon Cottages. Shared a two bedroom cottage with a private courtyard. This was a business trip.... oh but I wish my husband was with me to enjoy it! Absolutely gorgeous and private. If you're a discerning traveler and want a truly New Orleans experience this is definitely the place to be. Roderick our wonderful butler took great care of us. Very attentive and professional. Location was perfect, couldn't wait to get back to my room after a busy day of meetings. Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Cottage #2 for a long weekend getaway, and I can't say enough positive things about Audubon Cottages. When you enter the property from the street, it's like stepping into a personal sanctuary...much more like a private residence than a hotel. The grounds are beautiful, and very well maintained. Our cottage had a large parlor and two bedrooms, which made this perfect for sharing with another couple in our family. It was the perfect arrangement -- private, yet still sociable! The decor was very nice, as were the amenities: Keurig coffee maker, mini Sub-z fridge/freezer combo, free WiFi, and in-room iPod docks for charging/playing.
reviews.title: A perfect gem in the French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's worth paying a little to have a secluded, beautifully maintained oasis in the French Quarter. A lovely saltwater pool, friendly staff, the feeling that you're a million miles from the bustle of the Quarter. The cottages themselves are wonderfully refurbished, and have complimentary coffee, breakfast and wifi. Hard to think of a more relaxing, comfortable, luxurious, secluded and well-located spot than this. Can't say enough good things.
reviews.title: Amazing French Quarter escape

reviews.text: I have to admit, having lived in Baton Rouge for several years and knowing New Orleans fairly well, I wasn't sure what to expect from this property. One block down from Bourbon Street, parallel with Dauphine, I expressed concern to my boyfriend and my best friend (who was meeting us there) that this might be too in-the-thick of the Bourbon street madness. Boy was I wrong!
reviews.title: Roderick the butler should be given a key to the city!

reviews.text: To enter the courtyard at Audubon is to enter another world, one that seems quite far away from the craziness taking place on Bourbon. Serene. Relaxing. Upscale by any measure. This resort was a little slice of heaven.
reviews.title: Best French quarter getaway

reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful and well appointed. The pool small, but refreshing and pleasingly intimate. But HANDS DOWN this place is DEFINED by its level of service, which is excellent. Roderick, the resort's butler, would have drained the pool if you asked him to, he was THAT attentive. And, more than that, he really made the cottages feel at home for us. There was a level of laid-back trust that was really remarkable. We felt as if we were staying with old friends, which is a quality you can't market, only experience.
reviews.title: World Class Service and Accomodations

reviews.text: After our long weekend concluded I swore I would write a glowing TripAdvisor review, as I really felt customers should know just how wonderful Roderick -- and the whole staff really -- was at the cottages. Took us a little while to write this, but we hope that just tells you how we felt about our stay. Just how pleasant it was stayed with us, like a memory spent with those who wish you hadn't left. Bravo.
reviews.title: A taste of New Orleans

reviews.text: We have been fans of the Audubon Cottages for a decade. We have seen the good times and the struggles. We were so delighted to hear of the renovation and wanted to see it. We were so pleased with all they have done... It totally exceeded our expectations. Our cottage was beautiful and we were able to view the other cottages, as well, and all were fabulous!! The pool has been upgraded, the landscaping gorgeous, and the service delightful. Our French quarter butler, Roderick Bernel and his staff were so attentive and all our needs were met with such professionalism and warmth. All things considered, we would not change anything about our stay and we look forward to the next time spent at the place we feel stands alone as a French quarter destination! Highly recommend it!!
reviews.title: Fabulous Post-Renovation Stay

description: The Audubon Cottages are a local treasure, full of history, character and charm that evoke the feeling of old New Orleans. Once home to John James Audubon, each of the seven one or two bedroom Cottages is unique and have a private or shared courtyard. Complimentary French Quarter butler service, continental breakfast & WiFi is included.
